hackathon-description-text: Join this hackathon to participate in two weeks of hacking to imagine, design and implement unique projects using the power of blockchain based technology. Developers, students, and aspiring entrepreneurs are invited to compete and earn prizes as well as invaluable relationships with other top minds in the field. A panel of industry experts and leading venture capital firms including top ICO service providers will judge your work and determine what project has earned the highest awards. This is an open hackathon, so please do not be shy to participate as there are practically no limitations to what you can build. For more information see below.
hackathon-eligibility:
Participants of ALL AGES are welcome; if under 18 parental consent required. 
Team size is 1 - 4 participants. 
Team members can participate in multiple projects as long as they are not presenting more than once as a team lead.
hackathon-requirements:
Signup to rehearse on Monday. 
Rehearse on Monday 9th of October.
Submit project and team to Devpost by 12 pm Saturday, October 7st at the latest. Only minimal data is required in Devpost - eg the Title, Team, brief description. However the more data provided the better; if you have a presentation or video, include it in the Devpost.
hackathon-rules:
Team size 1 - 4 people (remote team member is ok, all presentations are in person or skype)
Required in order to be able to have a valid submission and to be able to present to the judges:
Rehearsals will be scheduled in 10 minute slots from 3PM  - 5 PM on Monday, October 9, 2017.
You may have four slides.
Recommendations: Rehearse your pitch. Spend 30 seconds or less on your slide(s). Spend as much time as possible showing what you built over the weekend.
 
Rehearsal signups will begin Saturday evening, May 20, 2017.

Please review The Hack Code of Conduct http://hackcodeofconduct.org

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Sit Down Meeting With ICO Service Provider

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3100 Airport Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Did you practice? Will an investor understand well enough to invest?
Is it big? Is it small? Is it just a hack?
Use of Blockchain / distributed ledger technology
Is the work timely and/or approachable?

hackathon-location-address: 3100 Airport Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90405, USA
